intro: Actinophloeus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed actinophloeus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with rough, bark-like texture and small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
